sentences.english: When you emperor of Manchoukuo, what rights did you have?
sentences.chinese: 你在当满洲国皇帝的期间，有什么权利吗？

sentences.english: Second, why did they choose to participate in Manchukuo?
sentences.chinese: 其次，为什么他们选择参加满洲国之列？

sentences.english: China neither recognized Manchukuo nor was able to recover Manchuria .
sentences.chinese: 中国不承认满洲国也无法收复满洲。

sentences.english: The puppet Manchukuo imperial museum is located in the northeast corner of the city of Changchun.
sentences.chinese: 伪满洲国皇陈列馆位于长春市东北角。

definition: Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Korean Empire, from fall of Joseon dynasty in 1897 to annexation by Japan in 1910
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, Japanese wartime slogan for their short-lived Pacific Empire, first enunciated by Prime Minister Prince KONOE Fumimaro 近衛文麿|近卫文麿 in 1938
pinyin: Da4 Dong1 ya4 Gong4 rong2 quan1

definition: Puyi, personal name of the last Qing emperor (reigned as child 1909-1911), the subject of Bertolucci's biopic The Last Emperor
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
the three provinces of Northeast China, namely: Liaoning Province 遼寧省|辽宁省[Liao2 ning2 Sheng3], Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3] and Heilongjiang Province 黑龍江省|黑龙江省[Hei1 long2 jiang1 Sheng3]
the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
